storyInfo: The Exemplars meet the enemy on the battlefield. The Duke of Caster receives news that Siege has brought the Realmblade to the front lines. Dublinn's forces, led by Eblana, join the battlefield, and the duel between the Duke of Wellington and the Nachzehrer King begins.

attributes.content: What the hell are those things up in the sky?!
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Get down!
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Urgh! *cough* *cough* *cough!
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Delphine, your right hand—
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Don't touch.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: This isn't any normal cannonfire. Sarkaz witchcraft... is corrosive in nature. I won't be much help.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Those people still trapped in the polluted area...
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: It's too late for them.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: You got shit in the air, stuff growing on the ground, AND crystals and dust everywhere! Can't even take a damn step!
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: The Sarkaz want to turn this battlefield into their home turf – forcing us to put down our gear and cower while they pummel us.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: When it comes to a head-to-head infantry battle, the Sarkaz will surely have an advantage due to their natural physique.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Alright, I get it now. It's all just a dirty trick!
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Which is why we can't afford to get caught off guard. If they ever get the drop on us, we're done for on the spot.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Morgan, get as many of our vehicles up and running as you can. Avoid any close combat with Sarkaz infantry.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Even if a vehicle's destroyed, don't overlook the mounted cannon. They're the best weapons we've got.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Understood!
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Delphine,send the signalers out as widely as you feasibly can. The Exemplars will be able to maintain communication that way, at the least.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Of course.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: If we want to push forward, we're going to have to take down that altar up ahead.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Horn, covering fire!
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Roger!
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Indra, your team's responsible for holding the enemy back. Doesn't matter if it's casters or Arts Creations or whatever those things are up in the sky.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: You got it.
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Dagda's team, you're with me.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Same as always?
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: Same as always.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: I can see the core – move out.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Another altar of Sarkaz witchcraft.
Climb, pull up, leap, bring down the hammer.
As the war rages on, they've become more and more familiar with these war machines resembling the devils' eyes.
They've become more and more familiar with war itself.
Vina often feels as if Indra, Morgan, and Dagda have changed somewhat. She trusts that the very same changes can be seen in her.
Is it a change for the better? Or a change that came far too late?
The devil's crimson eye stares at her.
The hammer comes down hard, and the altar begins to collapse before Siege even reaches the ground.
It worked! Phew...
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: We took it down even quicker than the last one.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: I hear something.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Back up!
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Something's... growin' outta that bloody thing! It's another altar, not far from the one we knocked down!
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: How many of these little buggers did they bury in the ground? Bloody hell...
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: There's no end to them.
Siege tightly grips her hammer.
They are adapting. But not quickly enough.
Trilby Asher, has the location of the Stone of the Sword changed?
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: I haven't been notified of any changes to the plan.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: Can the ship still move, with all the Originium crystals everywhere?
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: I'll have you know, Victoria has the most powerful fleet on land.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: We might be slowed a little, but we're certainly not without options.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: I hear naval guns.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: I believe it's the Iron Duke's Gastrell, going by the sound.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: The next round of our assault is beginning.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: One of Abercorn's assault ships has run into the Sarkaz advance brigade!
attributes.name: Flag Officer

attributes.content: The enemy was hiding in the fog and suddenly appeared–
attributes.name: Flag Officer

attributes.content: Our vision is severely limited by the Originium crystals and we can't follow their movements at all!
attributes.name: Flag Officer

attributes.content: Has mid-range communication been restored yet?
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: The ship's comm tower is still out of commission. Engineering's trying to repair it, but in this Originium-dense zone...
attributes.name: Flag Officer

attributes.content: Your Grace, what are you doing on deck?
attributes.name: Flag Officer

attributes.content: There's Originium dust everywhere outside, please try not to leave the command center...
attributes.name: Flag Officer

attributes.content: I've heard that Wellington always stands on the deck of the Gastrell, personally commanding his frontline troops.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: The Iron Duke has been through many battles, but you...
attributes.name: Flag Officer

attributes.content: Just now, the Gastrell opened fire.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: Your ears did not deceive you.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: Is he still pressing forward?
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: I'm afraid so. The Iron Duke's forces have penetrated deeper than we thought, and are about to collide with the Sarkaz core units.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: Wellington...
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: Does he plan to take the head of the Sarkaz regent?
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: The Wesley Wellington I knew was indeed a warrior before he became the Iron Duke.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: His bravery might have bordered on madness... but he would never gamble with the outcome of a battle.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: Regardless, the Iron Duke's recklessness has placed us at great risk.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: As per the initial orders, Duke Abercorn's and Duke Ashworth's men are following the Iron Duke... and among them, our vanguard as well.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: Factoring in the surrounding Originium, our front line is being stretched thin.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: What of the 'eyes' you placed aboard the Gastrell?
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: Nothing yet.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: Even us Trilby Ashers are experiencing some... serious delays in communication.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: Aileen, confirm the status of the Stone of the Sword.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: No issues so far!
attributes.name: Flag Officer

attributes.content: We will never allow the Stone of the Sword to be tainted by Sarkaz witchcraft.
attributes.name: Flag Officer

attributes.content: Your Grace, the Poet has launched a flare.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: So Alexandrina and the Sighs of Kings will arrive soon.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: Have your people keep a close eye on them. Don't let the sword get lost on the battlefield.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: We must put the Sighs of Kings to work immediately.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: Unless the comms are restored fully... the so-called ducal alliance is a non-entity.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: The enemy seems to be getting stronger.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: The same witchcraft... eats away at us while strengthening them.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: Siege, watch out!
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: Argh—!
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: Dagda!
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: The hammer falls, and a portion of the Nachzehrer warrior's body is caved in.
But he continues to advance.
A second swing. Then a third.
Dagda leaps back, splitting his waist with her metal claws.
The Trilby Asher's flaming blade pierces his chest.
(Dull gasps)
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: That's just one. There are still... many more ahead.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: These Sarkaz are truly...
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: Monsters!
attributes.name: Victorian Soldier

attributes.content: These bloody devils are all monsters, goddamn it! They're not even flesh-and-blood !
attributes.name: Victorian Soldier

attributes.content: Do you think they're already dead? Only the dead can...
attributes.name: Victorian Soldier

attributes.content: Already dead...?
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Strange noises can be heard in all directions.
They are distinct from the sounds of Originium crystal clusters piercing the ground. They are not omens to the explosion of Originium dust.
Captain, we can't hold out like this!
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: There's no end to them!
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Better focus on the one right in front of you, then.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: There's always going to be someone standing up front.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Raise the shield, fire the cannon. Repeat, ad infinitum.
Victoria possesses the strongest weapons in all of Terra. One shell can easily blow apart a Sarkaz's armor.
Just as quickly, two more Sarkaz rush forth at the same time to take the place. Then three.
The artillery fire unleashes its fury, but it cannot stem the surging tide.
*huff*... *pant*...
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: There's no end to the enemies.
She can hardly tell how many Sarkaz are on the ground in front of her; some standing, some lying.
The number of fallen Victorians is perhaps even greater.
She can hear Bagpipe's shouts and the whistling of her spear. From those she finds utmost solace, and that's enough to keep her fighting on.
A plume of firelight suddenly springs up not too far away.
Bagpipe...
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: What is it, Captain?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: I think... I just saw Hill again.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Oh, Hill.
That same face again. The same face that appears in her nightmares every now and then, reminding her of how tragically her teammates died... The face of that traitor.
...He's dead.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Is he that one... lyin' over there? Seems to have been killed in action some time ago... Um, Captain, just now, did he...?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: He moved.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: He's... standing up again.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: The man clad in the uniform of Wellington's forces staggers towards them.
He lifts the blade in his hands, and slashes at the Sarkaz in front of Horn.
The armor is too thick, and the recoil pushes his hands away. His arms contort strangely and he strikes a second time, then a third.
That familiar visage is getting closer and closer to them–
In the midst of the dead silent gray, only a tiny speck of purple dances.
It's her.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: It's... Dublinn!
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: 'I lay down now my soldier's honor here, so that in time the soil of Tara need no longer be soaked in carmine blood, and Draco cross no swords with Draco kin.'
'Be that unless a day comes, whereupon Red Dragon's flame should lead all those that fell, our fighters from the forge to be reborn.'
The third set of altars has been crushed!
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: Milady, our casters and flying soldiers are in position. We're about to approach the largest altar!
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: Our deceased compatriots have managed to protect us from the devils' vile pollution, but the destructive power of their witchcraft is unprecedented!
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: Allow me.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: ...Milady?
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: You're... going to destroy the altar yourself?
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: You, as my subjects, have done all you needed to do.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: I, as your sovereign, ought to lead you forward.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: How can I take this land as my own if I have never set foot upon it?
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: The Red Dragon's flame... shall fall upon the battlefield's front lines, just as it has for thousands of years.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: ––Our altar's being razed!
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: Stay in formation! Don't get scattered by those flames – keep casting!
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: They're nothing but a ragtag bunch of impotent outbloods–
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: I wouldn't be so sure about that.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: We are nothing like those Victorians who have it easy.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Every Taran warrior has been forged within the shadows, tempered by pain and suffering.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: We were once known as specters, for we knew most intimately the scent of death.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: I won't let you–!
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: Trying to turn yourself into an Arts catalyst... to detonate the altar?
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: As you wish.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: I'm... too late...
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: The spark of life gradually fades.
And in its place burns a deathly purple flame, leaping across the body of the slain Sarkaz warrior just as it dances in Eblana's eyes.
There is no Royal Court in death's domain.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Sarkaz, your people know death so well... only because you've fought enough wars.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: See that?
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: Death itself stands with us! Our enemies are not inscrutable demons!
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: Drag those Sarkaz out from their pretentious Arts Circles and give them a taste of our crossbows and cannons!
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: Brigadier... I see a flame burning within your eyes.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: I've waited far too long for this, just like countless other Taran warriors.
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: All of us grew up hearing the legends of the Empire's Death Knell, and enlisted with burning fervor in our hearts!
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: But over the last few decades, Wellington's administrator and the Duke have had their hands tied, and we've also been caught between the cracks of the other dukes' negotiation tables.
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: So many hot-blooded warriors were repressed because of their background, while many others perished in the Victorians' conspiracies.
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: I've endured for so many years, even to see myself turn into a scheming villain, all for the sake of witnessing a real war – not one ignited by the nobles' petty power-jockeying.
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: Only on such a battlefield can a warrior's death be glorious and meaningful.
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: If I am to die in this battle–
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: Then please bestow upon me your flames so that I may stand once more!
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: Until my remains are consumed fully by the fire, until our promised nation has been established, I shall never lay down my arms!
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: Excellent. Now then, come with me.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Do you see... that throne of deadwood?
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: That's the Sarkaz leader.
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: The Nachzehrer, Nezzsalem. He who calls himself the lord of war and death.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: The Sarkaz Royal Court sure has a thing for these overblown titles.
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: Overblown...? Hardly.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: He just happens to be ancient enough.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: But, he is not the only living legend here.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Why of course!
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: Not far away, naval guns roar.
Ancient witchcraft is not the only force that can cause mountains to move.
Now, let us pit war against war... and death against death.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: My Patriarch, the hunt has been cut short.
attributes.name: Sudaram

attributes.content: That Draco's flames have broken our formation.
attributes.name: Sudaram

attributes.content: ...Draco.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: Thousands of years ago, after the Sarkaz first lost their homeland, they once did battle against a red dragon on this very soil.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: Those flames turned fields of Sarkaz into charred stone. They are still beside us, and beneath our feet.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: We will slay her.
attributes.name: Sudaram

attributes.content: A red dragon will sate our appetite for a while.
attributes.name: Sudaram

attributes.content: She is not the one who drives this war.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: The Nachzehrer King turns his gaze towards a certain part of the battlefield.
Behind the Red Dragon's smoke and flames, a huge shadow is rushing toward them at an unexpected speed.
A titan that casts a shadow across the land, able to shake mountains and rivers with but a single breath–
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: No longer is it a mere red dragon.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: 'All parameters set!'
'Loading complete!'
'Firing interference shells!'
'Target locked on–'
'Main guns, first salvo!'
Confirmed hit!
attributes.name: Flag Officer

attributes.content: General, we've swept the obstacles away.
attributes.name: Flag Officer

attributes.content: Good.
attributes.name: Duke of Wellington

attributes.content: Gastrell, all ahead full.
attributes.name: Duke of Wellington

attributes.content: Our objective – the Nachzehrer's throne.
attributes.name: Duke of Wellington

attributes.content: The naval guns roar.
Wellington is well-acquainted with his most loyal subject – the oldest gun aboard the ship, that which assisted him in blowing open the gates of Lingones.
He killed the mightiest nomadic city on Terra. He pulled the spine from its corpse and made it a part of his warship.
Afterwards, he took the Gastrell to many lands, and conquered many foes.

The Arts orbs of Leithanian casters, the shields of Ursine vanguards, the golden blades of Sargonian assassins – he collected and modified the most valuable components of his enemies, and placed them upon his flagship.
But not for the sake of commemoration. Only those who have become weak and frail through the passage of time need to rely on these vestiges to remember the past.
The Gastrell must step over the bones of its enemies, assimilating their power so that it may become stronger.
Only this way can the two of them defeat even stronger enemies together.
Intercept them!
attributes.name: Sudaram

attributes.content: The crystal barrier... has been shattered.
attributes.name: Sudaram

attributes.content: The enemy continues to advance.
attributes.name: Sudaram

attributes.content: How they must long for death, using artillery fire to cleave a path.
attributes.name: Sudaram

attributes.content: Wave after wave of cannonfire pours down onto the sea of Originium.
Golden fragments crack and split apart, revealing a gap within those congealed waves.
How dare they... approach us––
attributes.name: Sudaram

attributes.content: A thick haze envelops the battleship.
Countless Nachzehrer warriors land on its deck, the entire vessel enveloped in the glow of witchcraft.
Rend, dismantle, corrode.
The cadence of gunfire gradually slows.
The hard, steel hull is being digested, just like all other prey that has fallen into the Nachzehrers' Arts circles.
Capture... complete...
attributes.name: Sudaram

attributes.content: Not yet.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: He lifts his scepter.
Branches grow rapidly from beneath the throne, blocking the front of the Nachzehrer warriors.
A shell lodges within the branches.
A few seconds later, the shell explodes, tearing the branches asunder.
For the first time since the battle began, the Nachzehrer's throne shakes.
My Patriarch!
attributes.name: Sudaram

attributes.content: It matters not.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: From the thick haze of corruption, the warship slowly comes into view.
Its outer layer flayed off by the corruption, almost half its main and secondary guns disabled due to the bombardment of witchcraft shells, only the steel frame remains shining.
Yet she is nevertheless still Gastrell, the mightiest warship in the land.
And her master–
The Sarkaz atop the throne lowers his head, noticing a faint shadow among the crystal clusters.
General, the Gastrell has successfully drawn the attention of the main Sarkaz force!
attributes.name: Redsteel Guard Member

attributes.content: They didn't even notice that we were transferred from the main ship–
attributes.name: Redsteel Guard Member

attributes.content: Wait, something's coming in fast!
attributes.name: Redsteel Guard Member

attributes.content: Guardsmen, tighten your formation!
attributes.name: Redsteel Guard Member

attributes.content: A salvo of artillery fire.
Only a few tiny twigs fall from the smoke and dust.
The force that was enough to shatter those crystalline waves cannot even shake the figure floating in the air.
The Nachzehrer King casts his gaze down upon the commander at the center of the army. Not far behind the old Feline, the bloodthirsty warship is waiting, eager to tear at his rotting flesh.
Duke... of Victoria.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: We have devoured many Victorians. General, Duke. Whatever the title, they all tasted the same.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: Conspirators. Merchants. But none of their warriors.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: They saw the battlefield as little more than a sandbox atop a table. The soldiers, mere chess pieces; war itself, only a tool for power and profit. How frivolous war was to them.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: But, you are different. Your ship has also feasted on many enemies.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: Ursine. Leithanian. Gaulish... And, Sarkaz. I can smell their flesh.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: They have also been absorbed by the Nachzehrers.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: Sarkaz... I've read plenty of records about you.
attributes.name: Duke of Wellington

attributes.content: The ancient Nachzehrers, with a tenth of the Victorian Army's numbers, were able to halt their advance on Kazdel.
attributes.name: Duke of Wellington

attributes.content: A feat of war that defies all reason, one that cannot be taught in military academies or replicated.
attributes.name: Duke of Wellington

attributes.content: Are you here to take revenge?
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: Haha. My only regret is that I hadn't been born two hundred years ago.
attributes.name: Duke of Wellington

attributes.content: They apparently call you the 'God of War'?
attributes.name: Duke of Wellington

attributes.content: No. There are no gods when it comes to war.
attributes.name: Duke of Wellington

attributes.content: There only exists... the moment of victory or defeat.
attributes.name: Duke of Wellington

attributes.content: Wellington draws his sword and points it at the Sarkaz in midair.
Behind him, all the guns on his ship are pointed in the same direction.
Nezzsalem, I will defeat you.
attributes.name: Duke of Wellington

attributes.content: Just like all the other mighty foes that have fallen at my hands.
attributes.name: Duke of Wellington
